text:
Champions League
OL revive, Lille collapses, crazy games ... the results of the Champions League!
Discover all the results of this first evening of the Champions League including the scores of OL, BarÃ§a, Liverpool, Inter Milan or Borussia Dortmund.
05 Nov 2019, 21:59 by Antoine Chirat



Marc AndrÃ© Ter Stegen: 6.5 / 10The matches go on and ter Stegen continues to be ultra regular. The few times he was worried, he was decisive in saving his team. Another perfect copy for the Barcelona goalie.Icon Sport



Jordi Alba: 4 / 10Very little visible in the first half, he will have proved dangerous only once in a nice move with Antoine Griezmann. Visibly touched, he left his place on the field to Sergi Roberto after the locker room.Icon Sport



ClÃ©ment Lenglet: 6 / 10Little worried during most of the meeting, he is now the boss of the Barcelona defense, the fault in particular a dive increasingly difficult. A solid match from the French defender.Icon Sport



GÃ©rard PiquÃ©: 5 / 10In difficulty against the Czechs, Gerard PiquÃ© no longer has the level of yesteryear. During the match, he did not hesitate to go out very high to annoy the attacking opponents, leaving many spaces in his back that the Slavia players have, fortunately for him, not able to exploit.



Nelson Semedo: 6 / 10Very active in the first period, he was very complicit with Ousmane DembÃ©lÃ©, despite blatant inaccuracies when delivering the last pass or even in the last move. He was then less comfortable with his replacement on the left side. Defensively, Olayinka has asked a lot of worries.



Sergio Busquets: 4 / 10The best hours of Sergio Busquets are now behind him. Very little present in the inter-game, it is now lacking cutting edge to help his team, even if the finesse of his touch of ball remains a treat. However, this could be limited for the rest of the season. Replaced by Rakitic at 68.Icon Sport



Arturo Vidal: 6 / 10With all the grinta we know him, Vidal tried to make his law midfield against the surly Czech. He was surely the most prominent man in the blaugrana interview. He could even have brought the goal of victory if Messi had not been offside before serving.Icon Sport



Frenkie De Jong: 5.5 / 10In a runner position that he does not appreciate necessarily, the former Ajax did not shine tonight. Discreet offensively, he helped against the defensive tasks, and was then more comfortable during the exit of Busquets and his replacement in front of the defense.



Ousmane DembÃ©lÃ©: 4 / 10If he was very complicit with Nelson Semedo during the first period, Ousmane DembÃ©lÃ© failed to erase the flaws that still stick to his skin. Very agitated, he sinned for lack of precision in his transmissions or in his last gesture. A benefit to review, even if the desire was there. Replaced by Ansu Fati at 64th.Icon Sport



Lionel Messi: 6 / 10It had been a long time since a goalkeeper had not bothered Lionel Messi so much. The Argentinian has tried his luck a great deal (20th, 34th, 42nd, 49th, 58th), beating each time on the Czech goalkeeper. Even when he finds Vidal pushing the ball into the empty net, he is finally reported offside. The "Pulga" did not turn into a hero tonight, in charge of revenge.



Antoine Griezmann: 5 / 10Always available, Griezmann is still struggling to be decisive. His agreement with his teammates is still to perfect, especially with Messi who has forgotten at least once (34th). However, he showed a good relationship with Alba in the first half.Icon Sport

BarÃ§a - Slavia Prague: the notes of Blaugrana!




Fourth day of the Champions League, first! Before the second part of tomorrow, groups E, F, G and H have delivered their verdict on Tuesday, November 5th. From Benfica's move to OL to Borussia Dortmund's Inter Milan reception to the Slavia Prague match against BarÃ§a, see the full evening results below.
